newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares set record, resistance seen at 900.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares set record, resistance seen at 900.

text.p: Bullish Norwegian shares closed at an all-time high on Thursday for the fourth consecutive session this week, underpinned by lower money-market rates, dealers said.
The Total index closed 0.34 percent higher at 897.28 crowns in trade worth 882 million crowns.

"The market is clearly liquidity-driven," said one dealer. "Because interest rates are falling, even the most conservative (investor) now rushes into the stock market. In the short term, 900 (points) is a resistance level which, if broken, could spark some profit-taking," the dealer said.

Shipping group Bergesen announced a nine-month, pre-tax profit of 97 million crowns, whereas analysts polled by Reuters had expected 208 million crowns. Bergesen's A share shed four crowns, closing at 141.
Forestry group Norske Skogindustrier's A share climbed seven crowns to 192 crowns in brisk trade worth 76.6 million crowns.
"(Pulp and paper federation) Norscan's inventory figures which were released today fell far below expectations, boosting Norske Skogindustrier" said one dealer.
